headline: Inside the media's embarrassing obsession with Michael Avenatti
subHeadline: Media darling no more: Avenatti enjoyed extensive TV time before indictment; reaction and analysis on 'The Five.'

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello, everyone. I'm Dana Perino along with Katie Pavlich, Juan Williams, Jesse Watters, and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5 o'clock in New York City, and this is “The Five.” Round two of the escalading feud between President Trump and Nancy Pelosi over claims of a cover-up and possible impeachment. The speaker, not backing away after saying the president may be breaking the law.

utterances.speaker: REP. NANCY PELOSI, D-CALIF.
utterances.sentences: And while he tries to say it's because I said cover-up, we've been saying cover-up for a while. I think what really got to him was these court cases and the fact that the House Democratic caucus is not on a path to impeachment, and that's where he wants us to be. I pray for the President of the United States.  I wish that his family or his administration or his staff would have an intervention for the good of the country.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Your comments almost suggest that you're concerned about his well-being.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.sentences: I am, and the well-being of the United States of America.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And just an hour ago, President Trump firing back with personal attacks against Pelosi and calling on White House aides to dispute her claims that he threw a temper tantrum during a meeting yesterday.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.sentences: It's a do-nothing Congress. The Democrats have done nothing in the House. They've done absolutely nothing. They don't get -- I mean, other than investigate. They want to investigate. She said I walked into the room right next door yesterday and walked in and started screaming and yelling, just the opposite. Just the opposite. Because I know that they will always say that, even if it didn't happen because this happened once before, I walked out, I was so calm. You had the group, Crying Chuck, Crazy Nancy. I tell you what, I've been watching her and I have been watching her for long period of time. She's not the same person. She's lost it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Mr. President, why did you have to raise your voice? (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: We had the meeting --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: Hi, Sarah. We're just talking about the meeting. You were there yesterday? Were you -- just come forward. What was my tone yesterday at the meeting?

utterances.speaker: SARAH HUCKABEE SANDERS, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.sentences: Very calm. I've seen both and this was definitely not angry or ranting. Very calm and straight forward.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Greg, it's like the two of them are trying to find each other's Achilles heel. She says if I say he's unhinge or crazy or he's like losing his temper it gets him so mad. And he's trying to say, oh, well, she's really lost it because she's getting up there.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.sentences: I have to say, I wake up every morning now and thank God I'm alive to see all of this, because if you were born in some other era or you're born later and not while Trump was president, you're missing quite possible one of the most entertaining eras in history. He's not just the president, he's like a one-man celebrity roast, right? I think -- what side would you want to be on? I don't like picking sides, but he has concrete achievement --

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.sentences: You don't pick sides.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, not at all.

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, HOST
utterances.sentences: I've never seen --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. We have one side which is concrete achievement, but it comes in blunt, you know, a total craziness. Or being on the side of Nancy which is no achievements at all and waging a political attack all the time. Being on the attack side is so much easier. Being on the other side, being a Trump supporter, watching what he does is just more fun. It's fun and there's achievements. How can you do wrong?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: She says that, Jesse, that the president is frustrated because the House is not moving towards impeachment and that's what he really wants. Morning Jo talked about that as well. And I think we have sound that I would like to play for you.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: He wants to be impeached so badly --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: -- so the Senate can then -- can then decide that he's not going to be convicted, can acquit him. He loves to be victimized as Nancy Pelosi said yesterday. Oh, poor baby.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. They think that the president wants to be impeached, but he's saying if you don't impeach or if you get rid of all this, we can do other things.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He does not want to be impeach, this is reverse psychology from Nancy and Chuck, because it's Scarborough. Because they know that -- they know that the Democrats want to impeach. And Nancy doesn't want it to happen, so they have to make it seem like Trump wants it. Oh, we don't want to do what Trump wants.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: When Bill Clinton was impeached, his numbers went up big time because people understood the pain that he went through, and they sided with someone who lied about sex.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Also because they thought the Republicans were --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And they overreached.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Overreached.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Trump can do the same kind of moves if he declassifies the FISA applications and all the investigations are done, and it proves that the Democrats planted evidence and set this whole thing up. He will look like the victim and the American people will see that this was a set-up job from the beginning. Everything that happened yesterday with Nancy Pelosi was spun into a big lie by the media. She was forced into saying that this was a cover-up because her caucus is out of control and she needed to say something.  It blew up the meeting, and now she's not delivered on border security and infrastructure. It's her caucus that's out of control. It's her that hasn't delivered for the American people. And it's actually her caucus that's trying to obstruct the investigation into the witch hunt. Think about it honestly for a second, Juan. Why would President Trump participate in another attempt to impeach him? It didn't work the first time. He was framed. He -- not guilty. And then they want to retry him? Double jeopardy. Why would you walk into that trap? After you were cleared, after you were found not guilty, why -- the Democrats are basically saying, ah, we can't impeach him and he's fighting back really hard, so that's why we have to impeach him. It doesn't make any sense.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Am I allowed to respond?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't even know where to start in this Alice in Wonderland story. First of all, they have not tried to impeach him yet, right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, that's what it was --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You said there was a first time. I don't know --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That was the attempt when they frame him for colluding with Russia.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I see. And secondly, guess what? It's the courts that are saying that, in fact, the Congress has a legitimate standing as an equal branch of government to have congressional oversight of the executive.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So let the courts decide.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Correct. They are deciding. They're saying give the documents, especially the financial documents --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It will work its way through the courts.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, OK. Here's -- just to Dana's larger point. Nancy Pelosi is one of the few national politicians who has Trump's number, and she is giving him his medicine in, you know, large doses. It seems to me when she says the family needs to intervene and I'm praying for the president, these things sting. It's like, you know, Trump has a genius of stinking nicknames on people, I think Nancy now has a genius of saying, hey, you know what? You're a little bit uncertain, you're wobbling. You need help. And all of a sudden now, he's trying --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So when is that not considered personal attacks? When he does it we scripted it as personal attacks. But when she does it's not personal.

utterances.speaker: KATIE PAVLICH, HOST
utterances.sentences: Does anybody actually believe that Nancy Pelosi is praying for the well-being of President Trump?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What she said -- she's not only praying for his well-being --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I thought that prayers didn't work.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: She's praying for the well-being of us, the American people under that president.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: She's praying for the president is what she's saying.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And by the way, Jesse, I just can't believe what you said about the media, because I think -- I was reading the papers this morning. I thought, wow. I know conservatives say this liberal media is so anti- Trump. Today, they bought Trump's story that, in fact, Pelosi had started this when she said --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: She did.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- there was a cover up. Nancy Pelosi and Chuck Schumer, everybody said, there's been an investigation going on all along --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: First of all --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- and they met with each other. But now all of a sudden it's, oh, he was so upset by what the Nancy said --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: So first of all, I'm not really clear on why we had a special counsel investigation if Congress is just going to redo the investigation and waste a bunch of more money to come to a different or same conclusion, probably the same conclusion because they don't have the same number of resources that a special counsel does. But getting back to the issues that the president was talking about today in terms of trade and China, Chuck Schumer actually agrees with President Trump on China. He's one of the people backing him up and saying we know that there's pain, this is very difficult for the middle of the country, but China has been cheating and we agree with the president, there has to be something long- term that is fix. The replacement to NAFTA is also another one. And where Trump is smart here politically is the Democratic base likes the union work. They like the infrastructure spending.  And Trump keeps coming to them with plans, publicly in these press conferences and you can drag them out because it's an event of an announcement or something else, and he's offering it to everyone to see and Democrats are not willing to do that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Chuck Schumer and Pelosi has an excuse, perhaps manufactured of their own making to be able to say, that's right, we weren't able to get anything done but that's because President Trump wouldn't work it with us, because if they don't have any accomplishment to run on they'll just figure out a way to blame him.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Remember, the Republicans had Congress for two years, both houses.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And everybody blames --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, it's the Democrats.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know what's interesting about the impeachment argument, though? The impeachment argument that morning blow said, he said we want impeachment but so does he so let's not give it to him. That's the same as the border. We all want the border. But because he wants a strong border, we're not going to do it. That's their -- they are infants. They're not adults.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's almost like how you treat some children, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They'll figure out a way like, oh, like they tried the reverse psychology but everyone -- we're all adults. We're following along.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm barely one.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You reach. You got there. You got there. You reached that level. You can ride the rides. All right, up next, growing outrage and concerns after the man known as the American Taliban released from prison early.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The creep known as the American Taliban is out of jail. Three years early due to good behavior. Yeah, he turned over a new leaf. All the time he was behind bars, he didn't behead anyone. That's the thing about jail, it's hard to get away with acting like a Taliban killer, which is why I don't understand good behavior. How does one get points for a path that's forced on you? Who knows what this loser would have done if he wasn't in jail? Actually, we do know.  In 2015, the traitor says ISIS did a spectacular job. He also endorsed violence to create a caliphate. He knew what ISIS was doing. They were killing people who have been guilty of nothing more than good behavior, every other day they dropped a video of a terrified person about to be beheaded, burned alive or drowned. So while innocent people were killed, he cheered. That's what you call a monster, a monster now free to roam. Unlike CIA Officer Mike Spann who was murdered shortly after interrogating this punk in Afghanistan. Now this could've ended differently. Treason was once punishable by death, back when adults ran this place. But we're better than that now. We're more enlightened. And besides, he looks like a folk singer. So prepare for the second wave of media analysis. He'll be the victim, you'll be the perp. No, actually, he was a political prisoner. They'll be lining up to give him that first interview asking him if he's healed from the trauma of terrorizing people. Then a speaking engagement at Columbia, perhaps a book deal. A yuck up with Bill Ayers or maybe Seth Meyers. And so, as always, America is the land of second chances even for scum who don't deserve a first. So what is the deal with early behavior, Katie? I don't get it. Like, shouldn't early behavior be tested on what you do when given a chance? Not when you're on a box.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: It just seems like people who take up arms against U.S. troops overseas for a terrorist organization shouldn't be given the option to have good behavior. And my understanding is that when he was in prison, he was still advocating for --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: -- jihad, still translating violent messages. And now they're saying, well, he's going to be let out and given three years of surveilled release and he won't have any access to kind of communications or whatever, which is bogus. Like, how are you going to prevent him from communicating with anybody?  And to your point about treason, I mean, yeah, this is the exact definition, whoever owing allegiance to the United States, levies war against them, or adheres to their enemies giving them aid is treason. And yet, that's no longer on the table. And I think it's a very disturbing trend, whether it's Bowe Bergdahl or this guy. But, unfortunately, I think you're right. I think he'll be under the cover of Rolling Stone any day now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, Dana, I imagine they must pay a lot of money to protect him, because, I mean --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You mean -- when after he's out?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah, when he's out, right? I mean -- no?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't know. I'm making that face because I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: How dare you not know? You know, we prepare for this show, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I did prepare. I prepared another point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, let's go for the other point.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So, there are 112 more of these folks that were Americans who've been convicted of terrorism or terrorism related support, and we're all going to face this because we have the shorter sentences. In the U.K. if you are convicted of terrorism or supporting terrorist -- well, that ranges, but it's a 40-year minimum. It's life or 40 years. And so, somebody like this would not have gotten out this quickly. Watching the videos for me as was like, wow, it feels like yesterday.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It really does. You know why? As we get older, time goes faster. That just seems like a year ago to me. And we're all getting up there, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: It's not like his ideology has changed --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: -- because he moved from al-Qaeda to ISIS. So when they say that he's reformed, it's like what does that mean?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't even know if that's a parallel step. Hey, Jesse, he went through the process.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So we're all about due process.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, we are.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I am. So he should you go out -- should we change the process?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: For traitors?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, the process is fine. They should just have charged him harder when they had the chance. Listen, the guy is named Johnnie Walker. I'm so disappointed. A great name in America, Johnnie Walker, and this is what he does? He goes and fights with the Taliban? I mean, such a waste - - it's such a waste of potential.  And also, think about it, there's Democrats on the left that want to lock up Trump but they want this guy going free.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah, it's true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: How sick is that? Think about the word traitor, this is a great opportunity to really find out what a real traitor is. They're calling Trump a traitor, this guy is the real traitor and that's what we should on here. You're right. Look what he did. The U.S. government has documents that said he was talking with other radicals in prison. He had not been reformed, he never renounced his violent ideology. And the National Counterterrorism Center says he continues to advocate for global jihad. So we have that and I'm sure he's gonna get beat up at some bar when he gets out on whatever it is. But --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: he doesn't drink.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- we really should started talking about what this is all about, Afghanistan. We're still in Afghanistan. What's the goal in Afghanistan? We spent a fortune in Afghanistan. Are we accomplishing the mission there? Because we need a lot of money to rebuild this place.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Well, I think the key --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I prepared one point.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: What he did to get into this situation. He was carrying a rifle, he's carrying grenades, he's goal was to kill Americans. It's not like he was just talking about --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He had forth knowledge of the prison uprising.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Right, exactly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, let me just speak for a second. I know you guys don't want to hear it from me, but I just want to pipe up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Before.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I would say -- I think he's a reprehensible character and -- but I will also say in court of what you've talked about a moment ago, Greg, he did his time, right? And so, now that he's getting out you can't say, well, but we don't like him and he did all these stuff --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We can say we don't like him.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, no, because you said you don't like the fact that he's espouses positions and views you don't like. I think one of the reasons America is so great is that we have first amendment --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And that's why they're going to surveil him.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, they can. They can for three years he's going to be under surveillance. But my point to you is, when you look at the record, nine out of the ten counts against him were dropped. He was never convicted of treason. I hear this in this conversation, that's not a charge that he was convicted of. He was convicted of violating an executive order that said no contact, no aid to the Taliban. That's all he was convicted of. And so he served his time. So, to my mind, you know, if you want to be angry at somebody, you know, go talk to the prosecutors. But as far as this young man is concerned, I think he's an American, there's about 60 other people in the next five years who have been convicted on terrorist charges who are going to be released. How do we as Americans deal with that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Dana, you made that point earlier.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's a great point. Put that in your great point journal.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It's very important --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah, I'm excited. I'm looking forward to his book deal, where he'll be teaching.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Rolling Stone --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Where will he be teaching? Brown? Yale?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, Brown or Columbia.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah, something like that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Deep breath.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Find your happy place. Up next, a video of the media looking like total fools, we have a lot of that, over their Michael Avenatti obsession.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: America's worst lawyer is going down the way he came in. After making a name for himself trashing the president, Michael Avenatti is now claiming Trump is to blame for his new wave of legal troubles. He believes his indictment yesterday is a product of political revenge that has, quote, Trump's fingerprints all over it. Avenatti facing multiple federal charges and a maximum of 400 years in prison. And we can't forget about the liberal media looking like fools after putting Avenatti on TV 254 times in a year leading up to all this. Here's a quick look back.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: He's Donald Trump's worst nightmare, Michael Avenatti.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Joining us once again is Michael Avenatti.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: That's for you, Michael Avenatti.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Michael Avenatti

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Michael Avenatti.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Michael Avenatti, thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: He's out there saving the country.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: He may be the savior of the republic.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You are something of a folk hero now.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I owe Michael Avenatti an apology. I say enough already, Michael. I've seen you everywhere. What do you have left to say? I was wrong, brother. You have a lot to say.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We think you guys are the tip of the spear that's going to take down Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Let's get into his head for a second, Michael Avenatti. What makes --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Lot of room.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's a lot of rooms. What makes him say, do you think, that he believes that Trump is responsible?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think he's about 28 days away from an insanity defense --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, this could be it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- because -- really, it is bizarre. Like, pretty much -- like look at all of the evidence. It's just not --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And there's no strategy behind that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- is Donald Trump responsible for the fact that he defrauded the client that was disabled?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, that was years before the Trump presidency.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It was President Trump's fault? No, I think -- the DOJ has very good lawyers who assess this out early on, the media did not..

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Has the media said anything about the latest development?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, man. It is pathetic how quiet they are. I mean, Stephanie Ruhle should address -- she called him brother, isn't that sweet? He's a scum. They embrace him. You know why? It's to his credit. He showed everyone how easy it is to commandeer the media and exploit their weaknesses. And what were their weaknesses? A desperate need to handicap Trump and ruin Kavanaugh. So he was there to do CNN and MSNBC's dirty work. He jumped on that horse and rode it to the top of their like guest heap. But they should -- I think they have -- they have a responsibility to address their mistakes. I've done that. When I make a mistake I was always -- Jesse, you do it almost every single day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The other thing to --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Gosh, I had a good point. Oh, he said he heard that Trump was -- had his finger prints all over it from a Republican close to Trump. There's no Republican going to talk to Avenatti. Nobody. I mean, he's a full grown liar and he's getting 400 years. I mean, he's not the Taliban.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: To your point about owning up to mistakes. Let's just say to someone I have on Watters' World a lot -- let's say Sebastian Gorka. Let's say Sebastian Gorka was hit with multiple felony charges, multiple --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'm just using this as an analogy. And he'd been on my show multiple times over the course of the last two years. Don't you think I would take a moment to address the fact that Sebastian Gorka who'd been on my show for hours maybe was involved in something and I am maybe --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You should have use like a made-up name.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And I have no idea that Sebastian Gorka has broken any law.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Jesse --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Don't you think the media -- don't you think CNN needs to take ownership of this a little bit?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes. But I'm not confident -- I'm not confident that you would do the same. Although, I do --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Come on. I would do it --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Look, you know, it wasn't just CNN. It was -- Anna Navarro on The View was saying that he was like the Holy Spirit --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Joy Behar said that he was saving the country. And I think to your theory about him saying it's Trump's fault. Whether there's a strategy there. If he says it's Trump fault, the media will jump on it --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

I pray for the President of the United States. I wish that his family or his administration or his staff would have an intervention for the good of the country.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Your comments almost suggest that you're concerned about his well-being.

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.utterance: I am, and the well-being of the United States of America.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And just an hour ago, President Trump firing back with personal attacks against Pelosi and calling on White House aides to dispute her claims that he threw a temper tantrum during a meeting yesterday.

utterances.speaker: DONALD TRUMP, PRESIDENT
utterances.utterance: It's a do-nothing Congress. The Democrats have done nothing in the House. They've done absolutely nothing. They don't get -- I mean, other than investigate. They want to investigate. She said I walked into the room right next door yesterday and walked in and started screaming and yelling, just the opposite. Just the opposite. Because I know that they will always say that, even if it didn't happen because this happened once before, I walked out, I was so calm. You had the group, Crying Chuck, Crazy Nancy. I tell you what, I've been watching her and I have been watching her for long period of time. She's not the same person. She's lost it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Mr. President, why did you have to raise your voice? (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: We had the meeting --

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: Hi, Sarah. We're just talking about the meeting. You were there yesterday? Were you -- just come forward. What was my tone yesterday at the meeting?

utterances.speaker: SARAH HUCKABEE SANDERS, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.utterance: Very calm. I've seen both and this was definitely not angry or ranting. Very calm and straight forward.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Greg, it's like the two of them are trying to find each other's Achilles heel. She says if I say he's unhinge or crazy or he's like losing his temper it gets him so mad. And he's trying to say, oh, well, she's really lost it because she's getting up there.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, HOST
utterances.utterance: I have to say, I wake up every morning now and thank God I'm alive to see all of this, because if you were born in some other era or you're born later and not while Trump was president, you're missing quite possible one of the most entertaining eras in history. He's not just the president, he's like a one-man celebrity roast, right? I think -- what side would you want to be on? I don't like picking sides, but he has concrete achievement --

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, HOST
utterances.utterance: You don't pick sides.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, not at all.

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, HOST
utterances.utterance: I've never seen --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. We have one side which is concrete achievement, but it comes in blunt, you know, a total craziness. Or being on the side of Nancy which is no achievements at all and waging a political attack all the time. Being on the attack side is so much easier. Being on the other side, being a Trump supporter, watching what he does is just more fun. It's fun and there's achievements. How can you do wrong?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: She says that, Jesse, that the president is frustrated because the House is not moving towards impeachment and that's what he really wants. Morning Jo talked about that as well. And I think we have sound that I would like to play for you.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: He wants to be impeached so badly --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: -- so the Senate can then -- can then decide that he's not going to be convicted, can acquit him. He loves to be victimized as Nancy Pelosi said yesterday. Oh, poor baby.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. They think that the president wants to be impeached, but he's saying if you don't impeach or if you get rid of all this, we can do other things.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He does not want to be impeach, this is reverse psychology from Nancy and Chuck, because it's Scarborough. Because they know that -- they know that the Democrats want to impeach. And Nancy doesn't want it to happen, so they have to make it seem like Trump wants it. Oh, we don't want to do what Trump wants.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: When Bill Clinton was impeached, his numbers went up big time because people understood the pain that he went through, and they sided with someone who lied about sex.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Also because they thought the Republicans were --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And they overreached.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Overreached.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Trump can do the same kind of moves if he declassifies the FISA applications and all the investigations are done, and it proves that the Democrats planted evidence and set this whole thing up. He will look like the victim and the American people will see that this was a set-up job from the beginning. Everything that happened yesterday with Nancy Pelosi was spun into a big lie by the media. She was forced into saying that this was a cover-up because her caucus is out of control and she needed to say something. It blew up the meeting, and now she's not delivered on border security and infrastructure. It's her caucus that's out of control. It's her that hasn't delivered for the American people. And it's actually her caucus that's trying to obstruct the investigation into the witch hunt. Think about it honestly for a second, Juan. Why would President Trump participate in another attempt to impeach him? It didn't work the first time. He was framed. He -- not guilty. And then they want to retry him? Double jeopardy. Why would you walk into that trap? After you were cleared, after you were found not guilty, why -- the Democrats are basically saying, ah, we can't impeach him and he's fighting back really hard, so that's why we have to impeach him. It doesn't make any sense.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Am I allowed to respond?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I don't even know where to start in this Alice in Wonderland story. First of all, they have not tried to impeach him yet, right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, that's what it was --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You said there was a first time. I don't know --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That was the attempt when they frame him for colluding with Russia.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I see. And secondly, guess what? It's the courts that are saying that, in fact, the Congress has a legitimate standing as an equal branch of government to have congressional oversight of the executive.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So let the courts decide.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Correct. They are deciding. They're saying give the documents, especially the financial documents --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It will work its way through the courts.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, OK. Here's -- just to Dana's larger point. Nancy Pelosi is one of the few national politicians who has Trump's number, and she is giving him his medicine in, you know, large doses. It seems to me when she says the family needs to intervene and I'm praying for the president, these things sting. It's like, you know, Trump has a genius of stinking nicknames on people, I think Nancy now has a genius of saying, hey, you know what? You're a little bit uncertain, you're wobbling. You need help. And all of a sudden now, he's trying --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So when is that not considered personal attacks? When he does it we scripted it as personal attacks. But when she does it's not personal.

utterances.speaker: KATIE PAVLICH, HOST
utterances.utterance: Does anybody actually believe that Nancy Pelosi is praying for the well-being of President Trump?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: What she said -- she's not only praying for his well-being --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: I thought that prayers didn't work.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: She's praying for the well-being of us, the American people under that president.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: She's praying for the president is what she's saying.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And by the way, Jesse, I just can't believe what you said about the media, because I think -- I was reading the papers this morning. I thought, wow. I know conservatives say this liberal media is so anti- Trump. Today, they bought Trump's story that, in fact, Pelosi had started this when she said --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: She did.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- there was a cover up. Nancy Pelosi and Chuck Schumer, everybody said, there's been an investigation going on all along --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: First of all --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: -- and they met with each other. But now all of a sudden it's, oh, he was so upset by what the Nancy said --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: So first of all, I'm not really clear on why we had a special counsel investigation if Congress is just going to redo the investigation and waste a bunch of more money to come to a different or same conclusion, probably the same conclusion because they don't have the same number of resources that a special counsel does. But getting back to the issues that the president was talking about today in terms of trade and China, Chuck Schumer actually agrees with President Trump on China. He's one of the people backing him up and saying we know that there's pain, this is very difficult for the middle of the country, but China has been cheating and we agree with the president, there has to be something long- term that is fix. The replacement to NAFTA is also another one. And where Trump is smart here politically is the Democratic base likes the union work. They like the infrastructure spending. And Trump keeps coming to them with plans, publicly in these press conferences and you can drag them out because it's an event of an announcement or something else, and he's offering it to everyone to see and Democrats are not willing to do that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Chuck Schumer and Pelosi has an excuse, perhaps manufactured of their own making to be able to say, that's right, we weren't able to get anything done but that's because President Trump wouldn't work it with us, because if they don't have any accomplishment to run on they'll just figure out a way to blame him.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Remember, the Republicans had Congress for two years, both houses.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And everybody blames --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, it's the Democrats.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what's interesting about the impeachment argument, though? The impeachment argument that morning blow said, he said we want impeachment but so does he so let's not give it to him. That's the same as the border. We all want the border. But because he wants a strong border, we're not going to do it. That's their -- they are infants. They're not adults.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's almost like how you treat some children, right?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They'll figure out a way like, oh, like they tried the reverse psychology but everyone -- we're all adults. We're following along.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm barely one.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You reach. You got there. You got there. You reached that level. You can ride the rides. All right, up next, growing outrage and concerns after the man known as the American Taliban released from prison early.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The creep known as the American Taliban is out of jail. Three years early due to good behavior. Yeah, he turned over a new leaf. All the time he was behind bars, he didn't behead anyone. That's the thing about jail, it's hard to get away with acting like a Taliban killer, which is why I don't understand good behavior. How does one get points for a path that's forced on you? Who knows what this loser would have done if he wasn't in jail? Actually, we do know. In 2015, the traitor says ISIS did a spectacular job. He also endorsed violence to create a caliphate. He knew what ISIS was doing. They were killing people who have been guilty of nothing more than good behavior, every other day they dropped a video of a terrified person about to be beheaded, burned alive or drowned. So while innocent people were killed, he cheered. That's what you call a monster, a monster now free to roam. Unlike CIA Officer Mike Spann who was murdered shortly after interrogating this punk in Afghanistan. Now this could've ended differently. Treason was once punishable by death, back when adults ran this place. But we're better than that now. We're more enlightened. And besides, he looks like a folk singer. So prepare for the second wave of media analysis. He'll be the victim, you'll be the perp. No, actually, he was a political prisoner. They'll be lining up to give him that first interview asking him if he's healed from the trauma of terrorizing people. Then a speaking engagement at Columbia, perhaps a book deal. A yuck up with Bill Ayers or maybe Seth Meyers. And so, as always, America is the land of second chances even for scum who don't deserve a first. So what is the deal with early behavior, Katie? I don't get it. Like, shouldn't early behavior be tested on what you do when given a chance? Not when you're on a box.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: It just seems like people who take up arms against U.S. troops overseas for a terrorist organization shouldn't be given the option to have good behavior. And my understanding is that when he was in prison, he was still advocating for --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: -- jihad, still translating violent messages. And now they're saying, well, he's going to be let out and given three years of surveilled release and he won't have any access to kind of communications or whatever, which is bogus. Like, how are you going to prevent him from communicating with anybody? And to your point about treason, I mean, yeah, this is the exact definition, whoever owing allegiance to the United States, levies war against them, or adheres to their enemies giving them aid is treason. And yet, that's no longer on the table. And I think it's a very disturbing trend, whether it's Bowe Bergdahl or this guy. But, unfortunately, I think you're right. I think he'll be under the cover of Rolling Stone any day now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, Dana, I imagine they must pay a lot of money to protect him, because, I mean --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You mean -- when after he's out?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, when he's out, right? I mean -- no?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I'm making that face because I don't know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: How dare you not know? You know, we prepare for this show, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I did prepare. I prepared another point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, let's go for the other point.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So, there are 112 more of these folks that were Americans who've been convicted of terrorism or terrorism related support, and we're all going to face this because we have the shorter sentences. In the U.K. if you are convicted of terrorism or supporting terrorist -- well, that ranges, but it's a 40-year minimum. It's life or 40 years. And so, somebody like this would not have gotten out this quickly. Watching the videos for me as was like, wow, it feels like yesterday.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It really does. You know why? As we get older, time goes faster. That just seems like a year ago to me. And we're all getting up there, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: It's not like his ideology has changed --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: -- because he moved from al-Qaeda to ISIS. So when they say that he's reformed, it's like what does that mean?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't even know if that's a parallel step. Hey, Jesse, he went through the process.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So we're all about due process.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, we are.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I am. So he should you go out -- should we change the process?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: For traitors?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, the process is fine. They should just have charged him harder when they had the chance. Listen, the guy is named Johnnie Walker. I'm so disappointed. A great name in America, Johnnie Walker, and this is what he does? He goes and fights with the Taliban? I mean, such a waste - - it's such a waste of potential. And also, think about it, there's Democrats on the left that want to lock up Trump but they want this guy going free.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, it's true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: How sick is that? Think about the word traitor, this is a great opportunity to really find out what a real traitor is. They're calling Trump a traitor, this guy is the real traitor and that's what we should on here. You're right. Look what he did. The U.S. government has documents that said he was talking with other radicals in prison. He had not been reformed, he never renounced his violent ideology. And the National Counterterrorism Center says he continues to advocate for global jihad. So we have that and I'm sure he's gonna get beat up at some bar when he gets out on whatever it is. But --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: he doesn't drink.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: -- we really should started talking about what this is all about, Afghanistan. We're still in Afghanistan. What's the goal in Afghanistan? We spent a fortune in Afghanistan. Are we accomplishing the mission there? Because we need a lot of money to rebuild this place.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Well, I think the key --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I prepared one point.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: What he did to get into this situation. He was carrying a rifle, he's carrying grenades, he's goal was to kill Americans. It's not like he was just talking about --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He had forth knowledge of the prison uprising.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Right, exactly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, let me just speak for a second. I know you guys don't want to hear it from me, but I just want to pipe up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Before.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I would say -- I think he's a reprehensible character and -- but I will also say in court of what you've talked about a moment ago, Greg, he did his time, right? And so, now that he's getting out you can't say, well, but we don't like him and he did all these stuff --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: We can say we don't like him.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no, because you said you don't like the fact that he's espouses positions and views you don't like. I think one of the reasons America is so great is that we have first amendment --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And that's why they're going to surveil him.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, they can. They can for three years he's going to be under surveillance. But my point to you is, when you look at the record, nine out of the ten counts against him were dropped. He was never convicted of treason. I hear this in this conversation, that's not a charge that he was convicted of. He was convicted of violating an executive order that said no contact, no aid to the Taliban. That's all he was convicted of. And so he served his time. So, to my mind, you know, if you want to be angry at somebody, you know, go talk to the prosecutors. But as far as this young man is concerned, I think he's an American, there's about 60 other people in the next five years who have been convicted on terrorist charges who are going to be released. How do we as Americans deal with that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dana, you made that point earlier.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a great point. Put that in your great point journal.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: It's very important --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, I'm excited. I'm looking forward to his book deal, where he'll be teaching.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Rolling Stone --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Where will he be teaching? Brown? Yale?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, Brown or Columbia.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah, something like that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Deep breath.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Find your happy place. Up next, a video of the media looking like total fools, we have a lot of that, over their Michael Avenatti obsession.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: America's worst lawyer is going down the way he came in. After making a name for himself trashing the president, Michael Avenatti is now claiming Trump is to blame for his new wave of legal troubles. He believes his indictment yesterday is a product of political revenge that has, quote, Trump's fingerprints all over it. Avenatti facing multiple federal charges and a maximum of 400 years in prison. And we can't forget about the liberal media looking like fools after putting Avenatti on TV 254 times in a year leading up to all this. Here's a quick look back.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: He's Donald Trump's worst nightmare, Michael Avenatti.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Joining us once again is Michael Avenatti.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: That's for you, Michael Avenatti.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Michael Avenatti

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Michael Avenatti.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Michael Avenatti, thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: He's out there saving the country.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: He may be the savior of the republic.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: You are something of a folk hero now.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I owe Michael Avenatti an apology. I say enough already, Michael. I've seen you everywhere. What do you have left to say? I was wrong, brother. You have a lot to say.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: We think you guys are the tip of the spear that's going to take down Donald Trump.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Let's get into his head for a second, Michael Avenatti. What makes --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Lot of room.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's a lot of rooms. What makes him say, do you think, that he believes that Trump is responsible?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think he's about 28 days away from an insanity defense --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, this could be it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- because -- really, it is bizarre. Like, pretty much -- like look at all of the evidence. It's just not --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And there's no strategy behind that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- is Donald Trump responsible for the fact that he defrauded the client that was disabled?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, that was years before the Trump presidency.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It was President Trump's fault? No, I think -- the DOJ has very good lawyers who assess this out early on, the media did not..

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Has the media said anything about the latest development?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, man. It is pathetic how quiet they are. I mean, Stephanie Ruhle should address -- she called him brother, isn't that sweet? He's a scum. They embrace him. You know why? It's to his credit. He showed everyone how easy it is to commandeer the media and exploit their weaknesses. And what were their weaknesses? A desperate need to handicap Trump and ruin Kavanaugh. So he was there to do CNN and MSNBC's dirty work. He jumped on that horse and rode it to the top of their like guest heap. But they should -- I think they have -- they have a responsibility to address their mistakes. I've done that. When I make a mistake I was always -- Jesse, you do it almost every single day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The other thing to --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Gosh, I had a good point. Oh, he said he heard that Trump was -- had his finger prints all over it from a Republican close to Trump. There's no Republican going to talk to Avenatti. Nobody. I mean, he's a full grown liar and he's getting 400 years. I mean, he's not the Taliban.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: To your point about owning up to mistakes. Let's just say to someone I have on Watters' World a lot -- let's say Sebastian Gorka. Let's say Sebastian Gorka was hit with multiple felony charges, multiple --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm just using this as an analogy. And he'd been on my show multiple times over the course of the last two years. Don't you think I would take a moment to address the fact that Sebastian Gorka who'd been on my show for hours maybe was involved in something and I am maybe --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You should have use like a made-up name.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And I have no idea that Sebastian Gorka has broken any law.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Jesse --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Don't you think the media -- don't you think CNN needs to take ownership of this a little bit?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Yes. But I'm not confident -- I'm not confident that you would do the same. Although, I do --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Come on. I would do it --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Look, you know, it wasn't just CNN. It was -- Anna Navarro on The View was saying that he was like the Holy Spirit --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Joy Behar said that he was saving the country. And I think to your theory about him saying it's Trump's fault. Whether there's a strategy there. If he says it's Trump fault, the media will jump on it --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And rallies the media.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, if he find somebody else who is delusional, the actor Smollett. There you go.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, I'm so surprised that all of you blaming the media. I don't - I think every media in America thought this was a salacious case in which he was representing a porn star who claimed to have an affair with the President, a man who turned out to be President. And then it turned out that there was a payoff to the porn star and a check signed by the President United States. Now, if you're a journalist and you don't cover that, you're negligible.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But that's why you fell for - no, but that's why you fell for Avenatti.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS

utterances.utterance: Yes, and - is he New Yorker, I don't know. Yes, obviously, in liberal cities it's leftist cities. They spend billions of tax dollars and they can't clean the streets. utterances.utterance: So, Jesse, the Governor of California gave a speech this week about trying to solve this homeless crisis saying it was a national problem, but it's actually pretty limited to a number of these big cities that have allowed for lots of illegal immigration to come in and lots of public resources to be used, and they can't take care of the people who have been living there on the streets for years.

Greg says you can use police departments in a in a smart humane way to clean up misdemeanor action and they have this politically correct mentality, that's permissive and it permeates everything.
